name: Tongariro Alpine Crossing
description: New Zealand’s most famous one-day hike, crossing active volcanic landscapes including Emerald Lakes and Red Crater.

name: Milford Track
description: World-famous Great Walk through pristine rainforest, waterfalls, and spectacular mountain scenery.

name: Routeburn Track
description: Classic route connecting Fiordland and Mount Aspiring National Parks, offering stunning alpine views.

name: Abel Tasman Coast Track
description: Coastal track with golden sandy beaches, clear blue water, and a mild climate.

name: Kepler Track
description: Loop track passing through alpine tussock lands, native forest, and lakes.

name: Rakiura Track
description: A Great Walk on Stewart Island with the chance to see kiwi in the wild.

name: Heaphy Track
description: The longest Great Walk, transitioning from forest to coastline with diverse scenery.

name: Paparoa Track
description: The newest Great Walk, crossing the Paparoa Range and commemorating the Pike River mining disaster.

name: Lake Waikaremoana Track
description: Track around the beautiful Lake Waikaremoana, passing through native forest.

name: Whanganui Journey
description: Canoe journey along the Whanganui River, drifting through deep valleys and gorges.

name: Queen Charlotte Track
description: Coastal track with magnificent views over the Marlborough Sounds.

name: Mount Taranaki Summit Track
description: Challenging summit route with 360-degree panoramic views in good weather.
